modelIdentification.name: NETN-BASE
modelIdentification.description: The NATO Education and Training Network Base (NETN-BASE) Module provides standard definitions of datatypes used by NETN modules. It depends on the RPR-BASE Module.
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.0 - Initial version developed by MSG-106 and MSG-134. Release included in NETN FOM v2.0
v2.0 - Updated version developed by MSG-163. Release included in NETN FOM v3.0
v3.0 - Updated version developed by MSG-191. The release is included in NETN FOM v4.0

poc.pocName: MSG-106 Enhanced CAX Architecture, Desing and Methodology
MSG-134 NATO Distributed Simulation Architecture & Design, Compliance Testing and Certification
MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation
MSG-191 NATO Standards for Federated Simulation and Services for Integration, Verification and Certification

attribute.name: UniqueId
attribute.semantics: Required. A unique identifier for the object. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated or pre-defined.

attribute.name: CreateTime
attribute.semantics: Optional: The time in the scenario when the object is created.

parameter.name: UniqueId
parameter.semantics: Optional: A unique identifier for the interaction.

parameter.name: SendTime
parameter.semantics: Optional: Scenario time when the interaction was sent. Default is interpreted as the receivers scenario time when the interaction is received.

simpleData.name: DirectionDegreesFloat32
simpleData.semantics: The direction is measured clockwise relative to the true north. Calculate values outside the range [0, 360) as modulo 360.

simpleData.name: AltitudeMeterFloat64
simpleData.semantics: Represents altitude relative to Mean Sea Level (MSL).

simpleData.name: EpochTime
simpleData.semantics: Scenario time is seconds since Epoch, where Epoch, e.g. is January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC or otherwise defined in federation agreements.

simpleData.name: LatitudeFloat64
simpleData.semantics: An angular measurement that specifies the northâsouth position of a point on the surface. Latitude is an angle that ranges from â90 degrees at the south pole to 90 degrees at the north pole, with 0 at the Equator.

simpleData.name: LongitudeFloat64
simpleData.semantics: An angular measurement that specifies the eastâwest position of a point on the surface. Longitude is an angle that ranges from â180 degrees to +180 degrees, with 0 at the prime meridian.

enumeratedData.name: ActiveStatusEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: A state which indicates the status of an object concerning its participation in the simulation. An object in an inactive state is not simulated and does not interact with other objects.

enumeratedData.name: HostilityStatusCodeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: The value represents the perceived hostility status.

enumeratedData.name: AggregateMissionEnum16
enumeratedData.semantics: Represents the general class or nature of activity related to a simulated entity's mission.

enumeratedData.name: DamageStatusEnhancedEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: The damage status of an object.

enumeratedData.name: TransmitterOperationalStatusEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: The current operational state of a radio transmitter.

enumeratedData.name: EchelonEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: The echelon level of a unit.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfSupplyStatus
arrayData.semantics: A list of supply types and their quantity.

arrayData.name: Callsign
arrayData.semantics: An identifier for a simulated entity. Callsigns should be unique in the context in which they are used but are not required to be globally unique.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfUuid
arrayData.semantics: An array of Unique Identifiers expressed as UUIDs.

arrayData.name: FederateName
arrayData.semantics: The name of a federate participating in an HLA federation. The value of this attribute corresponds to the `HLAfederateName` attribute of the MIM object class `HLAfederate`.

arrayData.name: GeodeticPolygon
arrayData.semantics: A sequence of geodetic locations defines a geographical area bounded by a closed path where the first and last locations in the sequence are connected. Each point is a geodetic coordinate in WGS84 on the earth's surface, and each segment is a great circle between locations.

arrayData.name: UUID
arrayData.semantics:
RFC 4122, section 4.1.2 using 16 bytes. Also referred to as Variant 1 or RFC 4122/DCE 1.1 UUIDs.
For example, 00112233-4455-8877-6699-aabbccddeeff is encoded as the bytes 00 11 22 33 44 55 88 77 66 99 aa bb cc dd ee ff.

arrayData.name: SymbolIdentifier
arrayData.semantics: A symbol identifier is represented as a string. The identifier uses a URI notation (uri:xxxxxxxxxx) where the URI moniker specifies the symbology standard, e.g. app6a, app6b, app6c, 2525b, 2525c, 2525d. If not provided, the federation agreement defines the default symbol standard.

arrayData.name: LocationStructArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of LocationStruct elements, may also contain no elements.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfResourceStatus
arrayData.semantics: The array of health states for a named resource.

arrayData.name: GeodeticPath
arrayData.semantics: A sequence of geodetic points defining a path.

fixedRecordData.name: LocationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The location of a point in space. Unless specified otherwise for the attribute, parameter, or datatype field using this datatype, the location is in the world coordinate system, as specified in IEEE Std 1278.1-2012 section 1.6.3.

field.name: X
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the X axis.

field.name: Y
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the Y axis.

field.name: Z
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: GeodeticCircle
fixedRecordData.semantics: A geodetic point and radius specifying a circle on the earth's surface (WGS84) where the radius is a great circle distance on the surface.

field.name: CenterPoint
field.semantics: The center of the circular area. Lat, Long on WGS84.

field.name: Radius
field.semantics: The radius of the circular area.

fixedRecordData.name: GeodeticLocation
fixedRecordData.semantics: A geodetic point, specified by latitude and longitude, with unspecified altitude. WGS84

field.name: Latitude
field.semantics: The latitude in degrees.

field.name: Longitude
field.semantics: The longitude in degrees.

fixedRecordData.name: GeodeticQuadrangle
fixedRecordData.semantics: A latitude-longitude quadrangle is a region bounded by two meridians and two parallels.

field.name: Point1
field.semantics: Lat, Long on WGS84

field.name: Point2
field.semantics: Lat, Long on WGS84

fixedRecordData.name: GeodeticPoint
fixedRecordData.semantics: A geodetic point is specified by latitude, longitude and altitude.

field.name: Latitude
field.semantics: The latitude in degrees.

field.name: Longitude
field.semantics: The longitude in degrees.

field.name: Altitude
field.semantics: Height Above Mean Sea Level

fixedRecordData.name: SupplyStatusStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Represents a single supply type and the quantity being offered or requested.

field.name: SupplyType
field.semantics: The type of supply.

field.name: Quantity
field.semantics: The number of units of the supply type. The unit measure depends on the supply type and shall use the SI units of measurement used for such supplies.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating. Max length 2 characters.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: CombatEffectiveness
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability. Max 5 characters.

field.name: HigherFormation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units that indicates number or title of higher echelon command (corps are designated by Roman numerals). Max 21 characters.

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes. Max 15 characters.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology. Max 21 characters.

field.name: SpecialHeadquarters
field.semantics: A text modifier for a unit's special C2 Headquarters. Max length 9 characters.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote, 1) local/remote status; 2) engagement status; and 3) weapon type. Max length 8 characters.

field.name: Quantity
field.semantics: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present. Max length 9 characters.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations with a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating. Max length 2 characters.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: SignatureEquipment
field.semantics: A text amplifier for hostile equipment; â!â indicates detectable electronic signatures. Max length 1 character.

field.name: Hostile
field.semantics: A text amplifier for equipment; letters "ENY" denote hostile symbols. Max length 3 characters.

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes. Max length 15 characters.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology. Max length 21 characters.

field.name: EquipmentType
field.semantics: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment. Max length 24 characters.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier is placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote 1) local/remote status, 2) engagement status, and 3) weapon type. Max length 8 characters.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations. Max length 20 characters.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations with a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating. Max length 2 characters.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: CombatEffectiveness
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability. Max length 5 characters.

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes. Max length 15 characters.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology. Max length 21 characters.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier is placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote 1) local/remote status, 2) engagement status, and 3) weapon type. Max length 8 characters.

fixedRecordData.name: SymbolStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Symbol Id and additional symbol amplification data.

field.name: Id
field.semantics: A symbol identifier. If not provided, derive the default value from the `BaseEntity` attribute `EntityType` and `PhysicalEntity` or `AggregateEntity` attribute `ForceIdentifier`.

field.name: Amplification
field.semantics: Additional symbol amplification data.

fixedRecordData.name: ResourceStatusStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The name of a resource and the number of instances of that resource by health status.

field.name: NumberHealthyOrIntact
field.semantics: The number of healthy or intact resources

field.name: NumberSlightlyDamaged
field.semantics: The number of slightly damaged resources

field.name: NumberModeratelyDamaged
field.semantics: The number of moderately damaged resources

field.name: NumberSignificantlyDamaged
field.semantics: The number of significantly damaged resources

field.name: NumberDestroyed
field.semantics: The number of destroyed or consumed resources

field.name: ResourceName
field.semantics: The name of the resource

field.name: ResourceType
field.semantics: The type of the resource (as described in the Bit Encoded Values for Use with Protocols for Distributed Interactive Simulation Applications)

variantRecordData.name: SymbolAmplificationVariant
variantRecordData.semantics: Different symbol amplification data for different types of symbols.

note.label: netn-base_changelog_3
note.semantics:
* Added `HLAobjectRoot` attribute `UniqueId`
* Added `HLAobjectRoot` attribute `FederateApplication`
* Added `HLAobjectRoot` attribute `CreateTime` * Added `HLAinteractionRoot` attribute `UniqueId` * Added `HLAinteractionRoot` attribute `FederateApplication` * Added `HLAinteractionRoot` attribute `SendTime`
* Removed datatype `AreaVariantStruct` * Removed datatype `PathVariantStruct` * Removed datatype `PointVariantStruct` * Removed datatype `PointTypeEnum32` * Removed datatype `PathTypeEnum32`
* Removed datatype `QuantityFloat32`
* Replaced datatype `NETN_SupplyStruct` with `SupplyStatusStruct` * Replaced datatype `ArrayOfWorldLocationStruct` with `LocationStructArray` * Replaced datatype `NETN_ArrayOfSupplyStruct` with `ArrayOfSupplyStatus`
* Removed datatype `TransactionId` * Removed datatype `UuidArrayOfHLAbyte16` * Removed datatype `ArrayOfText64` * Removed datatype `GeodeticPath` * Removed datatype `TimeSecInt32` * Removed datatype `GeoLocationTypeEnum32` * Removed datatype `ArrayOfString` * Removed datatype `Text64` * Removed datatype `CancellationReasonEnum32` * Replaced datatype `PercentFloat64` with `PercentFloat32` * Replaced datatype `EpochTimeSecInt64` with `EpochTime` * Added datatype `EquipmentSymbolAmplificationStruct` * Added datatype `UnitSymbolAmplificationStruct` * Added datatype `InstallationSymbolAmplificationStruct` * Added datatype `TimeMillisecondIn64` * Added datatype `EpochTime` * Added datatype `HostilityStatusCodeEnum32` moved from NETN-ORG * Added datatype `DamageStatusEnum32` * Added datatype `LocationStruct` * Added datatype `SymbolAmplificationVariant`
* Added datatype `SymbolStruct`
* Added datatype `TransmitterOperationalStatusEnum8` * Added datatype `ResourceStatusStruct` * Added datatype `ArrayOfResourceStatus`
* Changed representation of `QuantityInt32` to `HLAinteger32BE`
* Replaced datatype `LatLongDegreesFloat64` with `LatitudeFloat64` and `LongitudeFloat64`

note.label: netn-base_changelog_2
note.semantics: * Changed `modelIdentification` `securityClassification` from `unclassified` to `Not Classified` * Changed `modelIdentification` `other` to include license information * Changed `modelIdentification` `useHistory` to only include formally released versions * Added datatype `AltitudeMeterFloat64` * Added datatype `DegreesPerSecondFloat32` * Added datatype `DirectionDegreesFloat32` * Added datatype `DraughtMeterFloat32` * Modified datatype `TimeSecInt64` to `EpochTimeSecInt64` * Added datatype `IMOType` * Added datatype `LatLongDegreesFloat64` * Added datatype `MassConcentrationFloat32` * Added datatype `MassDensityFloat32` * Added datatype `MIDType` * Added datatype `PercentFloat64` * Updated datatype `QuantityFloat32` * Added datatype `QuantityFloat64` * Added datatype `QuantityInt32` * Added datatype `ShipTypeType` * Added datatype `TimeSecInt32` * Added datatype `CancellationReasonEnum32` * Added datatype `EchelonEnum32` * Added datatype `EchelonEnum32` * Added datatype `SymbolStandardEnum32` * Added datatype `GeoLocationTypeEnum32` * Added datatype `ArrayOfStringType` * Added datatype `ArrayOfText64` * Added datatype `FederateName` * Removed datatype `ArrayOfWorldLocationStruct2` * Removed datatype `ArrayOfWorldLocationStruct3` * Added datatype `GeodeticPath` * Added datatype `GeodeticPolygon` * Added datatype `SymbolIdentifier15` * Added datatype `SymbolIdentifier30` * Added datatype `Text64` * Added datatype `TransactionId` * Added datatype `UUID` * Added datatype `GeocentricCircle` * Added datatype `GeodeticCircle` * Added datatype `GeodeticLocation` * Added datatype `GeodeticQuadrangle` * Added datatype `GeodeticPoint` * Added datatype `AreaVariantStruct` * Added datatype `PathVariantStruct` * Added datatype `PointVariantStruct` * Added datatype `SymbolVariantStruct`

note.label: netn-base_changelog_1
note.semantics:
* v1.0.0 - First version in NETN FOM v2 * v1.0.1 - Added array data type: ArrayOfWorldLocation3 (moved from NETN_Aggregate FOM module) * v1.0.2 - Renamed data type, new name: ArrayOfWorldLocationStruct3. Updated References, Dependency
Previous history Common datatypes were defined in NETN FOM v1.0 modules NETN_AggDeagg_v1.07_2010, NETN_Service_Consumer_Provider_v1.0.3_2010 and NETN_Logistics_v1.1.2_2010.

note.label: netn-base_overview
note.semantics:
## Overview
NETN-BASE defines attributes and parameters for the HLA object and interaction root classes. These attributes and parameters are available for all object and interaction classes in all NETN-FOM modules.
```mermaid classDiagram direction TB
HLAobjectRoot : CreateTime HLAobjectRoot : UniqueId
HLAinteractionRoot : SendTime HLAinteractionRoot : UniqueId ```
## Identifiers
The NETN-FOM uses Universally Unique Identifiers (UUID) as defined in ISO/IEC 9834-8:2014.
An NETN-federate shall publish the `UniqueId` attribute for all objects it creates in the federation. The value of this attribute can either be predefined, e.g., based on scenario data or generated using standard methods for generating UUID. It is the responsibility of the federate to update the attributes to ensure uniqueness in the federation.
A non-NETN federate does not publish the `UniqueId` attribute. Therefore, it becomes unowned and available for acquisition for objects registered by non-NETN federates. In a NETN federation, the ownership of all unowned required attributes, such as `UniqueId`, shall be acquired and published by a NETN federate.
The NETN-FOM also uses UUID to reference objects and relies on federates to resolve references.
Other unique identifiers may be required for compatibility with RPR-FOM, e.g., the `EntityIdentifier` attribute for the RPR-FOM `BaseEntity` object class.
The NETN-BASE also defines an optional `UniqueId` parameter for the `HLAinteractionRoot` interaction class. This parameter's primary purpose is to allow subsequent interactions, e.g., acknowledgements, to reference a previously sent interaction.
## Time
Logical time (or Simulation Time) coordinates and synchronizes data exchange in a distributed simulation. HLA time management services can control the advancement of logical time. To pace logical time, use wall-clock time to manage a real-time or scaled real-time simulation. The RPR-FOM handles synchronization by timestamping each update and relying on synchronized system clocks to advance time. Logical time representation and the methods for synchronizing the advancing of time in a distributed simulation can vary between different federations. The NETN-FOM does not specify or require any specific method for synchronizing logical time. Use federation agreements to clarify the synchronization method.
Scenario time is displayed to simulation operators working with the actual scenario. Scenario time can be linked to the pace of logical time advancement but is an independent representation. For example, during simulation, the logical time is strictly increasing (much like wall-clock time) and can never move backwards. However, scenario time may move forward or backwards.
In NETN, the scenario time is defined as seconds since Epoch, where Epoch is defined in federation agreements, e.g. January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.
The NETN-BASE module defines the optional HLAobjectRoot attribute `CreateTime` for timestamping objects with the scenario time corresponding to the time the object was created in the federation. Similarly, the optional HLAinteractionRoot parameter `SendTime` represents the time in the scenario when the interaction was sent.
